summary: For 3 decades, citizens of Micronesia, the Marshall Islands, and Palau have been able to live and work in the U.S. indefinitely without a visa through special agreements called compacts. The number of people who migrate to the U.S. under the auspices of these compacts has grown by about 70% in the last decade, particularly on the mainland. U.S. areas reported rising costs of public...
title: Compacts of Free Association: Populations in U.S. Areas Have Grown, with Varying Reported Effects
